intro: Urostigma arnottianum, commonly known as the Australian flame tree, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its striking orange-red flowers that appear in late winter to early spring. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces legume pods that contain several seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display and is adaptable to various soil types. The species is also valued for its ability to thrive in coastal and semi-arid environments.
